author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: تَرَى يا إِلهِي بِأَنَّ البَهَاءَ يَذْكرُكَ بَعْدَ الَّذِيْ وَرَدَ عَلَيهِ مِنَ البَلايا ما لا يَقْدِرُ أَنْ يُحْصِيَهُ أَحَدٌ إِلاَّ نَفْسُكَ وَيُثْنِيكَ فِيْ السِّجْنِ بِما أَلْهَمْتَهُ مِنْ بَدائِعِ وَصْفِكَ عَلَى شَأْنٍ ما مَنَعَتْهُ الأَعدآءُ عَنْ ذِكْرِكَ يا مالِكَ الأَسْماءِ لَكَ الحَمْدُ
translation: Thou dost witness, O my God, how He Who is Thy splendor calleth Thee to remembrance, notwithstanding the manifold troubles that have touched Him, troubles which none except Thee can number. Thou beholdest how, in His prison-house, He recounteth Thy wondrous praises with which Thou didst inspire Him. Such is His fervor that His enemies are powerless to deter Him from mentioning Thee, O Thou Who art the Possessor of all names!
